column4: if somebody feels the urge to wanna help me with my thrice (getting frustered) crashed ubuntu install i'd appriciate it alot, this third install was the best, 2 OS, custom grub n uspash screens, shared win/lin hd space, pimp gui, but anywho i removed my pcmcia card n it froze, crashed, i fsck'd all the partitions from the live cd (which i've been using for 2 weeks) and all my files have been restored to the lost+found folder. all
i need is a "Your screwed" or help restoring my file structure if possible. :)
i know :( i've googl'd all i can google
usually you are out of luck :-(
next time just back up /etc and maybe the dot folders in ~
you can put up a thread on the forums, i think there is also space on the wiki
ouch, just switch to a vt and copy over a backup xorg.conf
i've read of bugs with opengl and the i915gm opengl/dri support... there's workarounds but i dont know where/how to insert some lines of code i've found
well, i am using hte 855gm which uses the 915 driver, and everything works for me
i know it shold work, but it doesnt... there's others with the same chipset that say it works, and other like me that know it doesnt
in that case, i would try downloading the latest kernel from kernel.org and compiling it with the 915 drivers
have you compiled the kernel before?
i havent had much luck with compiling... u know of a good how-to?
i've tried compiling xorg-air but not much luck, did the menu-config and make and whatnot and usually got errors with a main.o file
you don't need to recompile xorg, just the kernel module
i think i'll do some googlin' on that so i dont bombard you with noobish questions :)
thanks, 'cause i was trying to compile it all
